digital threats may reward these undervalued cybersecurity stocks.</li><li><strong>Fortinet</strong> (<a class="ipm-ticker-link" href="https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/ftnt-stock-quote/"><strong>FTNT</strong></a>): Leading cybersecurity firm with solid growth projections and a positive outlook for sales, offering potential upside for investors.</li><li><strong>A10 Networks</strong> (<a class="ipm-ticker-link" href="https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/aten-stock-quote/"><strong>ATEN</strong></a>): Provider of diverse protective solutions, showing positive sales growth prospects, and presenting an intriguing opportunity in the cybersecurity sector.</li><li><strong>Gen Digital</strong> (<a class="ipm-ticker-link" href="https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/gen-stock-quote/"><strong>GEN</strong></a>): Multinational software company offering robust digital security solutions and demonstrating strong revenue growth in the cybersecurity sector.</li></ul>							</div>							<div class="ad-wrapper"></div>														<figure class="entry-featured-image">			<div>				<img width="768" height="432" src="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/cybersecurity1600b-768x432.jpg" class="attachment-medium_large size-medium_large wp-post-image" alt="Undervalued 768w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/cybersecurity1600b-300x169.jpg 300w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/cybersecurity1600b-1024x576.jpg 1024w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/cybersecurity1600b-200x113.jpg 200w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/cybersecurity1600b-400x225.jpg 400w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/cybersecurity1600b-116x65.jpg 116w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/cybersecurity1600b-100x56.jpg 100w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/cybersecurity1600b-89x50.jpg 89w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/cybersecurity1600b-78x44.jpg 78w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/cybersecurity1600b.jpg 1600w" sizes="(max-width: 768px) 100vw, 768px" />			</div>							<figcaption>																<p class="source">Source: Shutterstock</p>									</figcaption>					</figure>							<div class="entry-content story">							<p>Ever since the rise of computer technology, <a class="auto-linked-term" href="https://investorplace.com/industries/technology/cybersecurity/">cybersecurity stocks</a> have represented an important cog in the innovation ecosystem. However, their pertinence has risen significantly in recent years. First, cyberattacks are becoming increasingly complex and therefore damaging. Recently, <strong>Microsoft</strong> (NASDAQ:<a class="ipm-ticker-link" href="https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/msft-stock-quote/"><strong>MSFT</strong></a>) stated that it’s still dissecting a <a href="https://abcnews.go.com/International/microsoft-russian-state-backed-hack-update/story?id=107927553" rel="nofollow">data breach that occurred in January</a>. That attack stemmed from a Russian state-sponsored actor, thus underscoring the wide addressable market for undervalued cybersecurity stocks.</p><p>Second, artificial intelligence may help shorten the learning curve for novice hackers. That’s going to be increasingly problematic as AI becomes further ingrained in everyday society. As a result, these undervalued cybersecurity stocks should attract significant attention.</p><h2 class="wp-block-heading">Fortinet (FTNT)</h2><div id="1429082" class="wp-caption alignright"><img src="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/plugins/lazy-load/images/1x1.trans.gif" data-lazy-src="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/ftnt-stock-1-300x169.jpg" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="300" height="169" alt="The Fortinet logo on a wall" class="alignright wp-image-1429082" srcset="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/ftnt-stock-1-300x169.jpg 300w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/ftnt-stock-1-768x432.jpg 768w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/ftnt-stock-1-1024x576.jpg 1024w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/ftnt-stock-1-200x113.jpg 200w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/ftnt-stock-1-400x225.jpg 400w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/ftnt-stock-1-116x65.jpg 116w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/ftnt-stock-1-100x56.jpg 100w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/ftnt-stock-1-89x50.jpg 89w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/ftnt-stock-1-78x44.jpg 78w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/ftnt-stock-1.jpg 1600w" sizes="(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px"><div class="ipm_image_source">Source: Sundry Photography / Shutterstock.com</div></div><p>One of the top undervalued cybersecurity stocks, <strong>Fortinet</strong> (NASDAQ:<a class="ipm-ticker-link" href="https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/ftnt-stock-quote/"><strong>FTNT</strong></a>) develops and sells security solutions such as firewalls, endpoint security and intrusion detection systems. However, it doesn’t have the greatest level of endorsement among analysts with a <a href="https://www.tipranks.com/stocks/ftnt/forecast" rel="nofollow">consensus hold view</a>. This assessment breaks down as 10 buys, 22 holds and two sells. However, the high-side target lands at $90, indicating sizable upside potential.</p><p>Despite some variance in terms of market expectations, overall, the experts have a positive view of Fortinet’s projected growth. By the end of this fiscal year, they <a href="https://finance.yahoo.com/quote/ftnt/analysis" rel="nofollow">anticipate that sales will hit $5.78 billion</a>, up 9% from last year’s tally of $5.3 billion. In 2025, they believe a top line of $6.57 billion is possible. If so, that would imply a 13.6% jump from 2024’s forecasted revenue.</p><p>To be fair, the heightened interest in digital protection means it’s rather difficult to find undervalued cybersecurity stocks. Still, FTNT trades at a <a href="https://www.gurufocus.com/stock/FTNT/summary?search=ftnt" rel="nofollow">price/earnings-to-growth (PEG) ratio of 1.12X</a>. That’s lower than the sector median 1.62X. Combined with Fortinet’s consistent profitability, it’s one of the deals to consider.</p><h2 class="wp-block-heading">A10 Networks (ATEN)</h2><div id="2261436" class="wp-caption alignright"><img src="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/plugins/lazy-load/images/1x1.trans.gif" data-lazy-src="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/07/aten-a10-1600-300x169.png" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="300" height="169" alt="The logo for A10 (ATEN) is seen on the side of a building." class="alignright wp-image-2261436" srcset="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/07/aten-a10-1600-300x169.png 300w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/07/aten-a10-1600-1024x576.png 1024w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/07/aten-a10-1600-768x432.png 768w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/07/aten-a10-1600-1536x864.png 1536w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/07/aten-a10-1600-200x113.png 200w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/07/aten-a10-1600-400x225.png 400w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/07/aten-a10-1600-116x65.png 116w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/07/aten-a10-1600-100x56.png 100w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/07/aten-a10-1600-89x50.png 89w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/07/aten-a10-1600-78x44.png 78w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/07/aten-a10-1600.png 1600w" sizes="(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px"><div class="ipm_image_source">Source: Michael Vi / Shutterstock.com</div></div><p>Specializing in the manufacturing of application delivery controllers, <strong>A10 Networks</strong> (NYSE:<a class="ipm-ticker-link" href="https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/aten-stock-quote/"><strong>ATEN</strong></a>) offers a wide variety of protective solutions. These include web application firewalls, cloud access proxy and distributed denial-of-service (DDoS) protection. To be fair, ATEN hasn’t had the most promising look across the past 52 weeks. Notably, the company’s third-quarter earnings report was <a href="https://finance.yahoo.com/news/a10-networks-aten-falls-28-141800625.html" rel="nofollow">considered dismal</a>.</p><p>Still, the overall picture appears positive. Analysts believe that in fiscal 2024, sales should reach $263.74 million. That would be up almost 5% against last year’s print of $251.7 million. Circumstances may improve even more by the end of 2025, with sales projected to reach just over $286 million. That would imply an 8.5% gain from 2024’s forecasted top line.</p><p>One positive related to the messy price action is the valuation. Specifically, ATEN is one of the undervalued cybersecurity stocks, trading at a <a href="https://www.gurufocus.com/stock/ATEN/summary?search=aten" rel="nofollow">forward earnings multiple of 16.56X</a>. That’s lower than the sector median 23.75X.</p><p>Lastly, analysts peg shares a <a href="https://www.tipranks.com/stocks/aten/forecast" rel="nofollow">consensus moderate buy</a> with a $16 price target. The high-side target rises to $17, making ATEN an intriguing proposition.</p><h2 class="wp-block-heading">Gen Digital (GEN)</h2><div id="1406320" class="wp-caption alignright"><img src="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/plugins/lazy-load/images/1x1.trans.gif" data-lazy-src="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/cybersecurity1600d-300x169.jpg" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="300" height="169" alt="A person holding a tablet with a key lock hologram floating above it. Represents cybersecurity stocks." class="alignright wp-image-1406320" srcset="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/cybersecurity1600d-300x169.jpg 300w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/cybersecurity1600d-768x432.jpg 768w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/cybersecurity1600d-1024x576.jpg 1024w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/cybersecurity1600d-200x113.jpg 200w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/cybersecurity1600d-400x225.jpg 400w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/cybersecurity1600d-116x65.jpg 116w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/cybersecurity1600d-100x56.jpg 100w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/cybersecurity1600d-89x50.jpg 89w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/cybersecurity1600d-78x44.jpg 78w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/cybersecurity1600d.jpg 1600w" sizes="(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px"><div class="ipm_image_source">Source: Shutterstock</div></div><p>A multinational software company, <strong>Gen Digital</strong> (NASDAQ:<a class="ipm-ticker-link" href="https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/gen-stock-quote/"><strong>GEN</strong></a>) provides various solutions to help people and enterprises extract the most out of the digital world safely, privately, and confidently. Its brands include popular labels such as <a href="https://www.gendigital.com/us/en/" rel="nofollow">Norton and LifeLock</a>. It also owns CCleaner, which is one of the top platforms for computer optimization solutions.</p><p>Over the trailing one-year period, GEN stock has enjoyed a robust performance, which isn’t surprising. After all, new threats seemingly emerge all the time. Notably, by the end of this fiscal year, experts believe that Gen Digital will ring up sales of $3.81 billion. That’s up 14.1% against last year’s print of $3.34 billion.</p><p>In 2025, they believe revenue of $3.94 billion is in order. If so, that would be 3.5% up 2024’s projected top line. Enticingly, GEN stock trades at <a href="https://www.gurufocus.com/stock/GEN/summary?search=gen" rel="nofollow">only 9.75X forward earnings</a>. Again, that’s well below the sector median of 23.75X.</p><p>Finally, covering analysts rate GEN a <a href="https://www.tipranks.com/stocks/gen/forecast" rel="nofollow">consensus strong buy</a> with a $27.25 average price target. Even at the low target of $25, this implies a decent upside return.</p><p><em>On the date of publication, Josh Enomoto</em><em> did not have (either directly or indirectly) any positions in the securities mentioned in this article. </em><em>The opinions expressed in this article are those of the writer, subject to the InvestorPlace.com </em><a href="https://investorplace.com/corporate/investorplace-publishing-guidelines/" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener"><em>Publishing Guidelines</em></a><em>.</em><em></em></p><div class="ipm-author-short-bio"><p>A former senior business analyst for Sony Electronics, Josh Enomoto has helped broker major contracts with Fortune Global 500 companies. articles.title: 7 High-Quality Blue-Chip Stocks to Buy if You're Looking for Stability
summarizedBulletPoints: - **Microsoft (MSFT)**: A key player in technology, known for investments in artificial intelligence that have yielded significant benefits. Microsoft is considered a blue-chip stock due to its integral role in business operations worldwide, with its software being a critical part of the digital infrastructure. Analysts project a substantial revenue growth for Microsoft, anticipating it to reach $244.29 billion by the end of the year, marking a 15.3% increase from the prior year. Furthermore, revenue is expected to climb to $279.31 billion by 2025. With its broad impact and continuing innovation, Microsoft is strongly rated by experts, suggesting a bright future and making it a top consideration for stability-focused investors.
articles.desc: At first glance, a concerted focus on stable blue-chip stocks might seem excessively cautious. After all, the market is booming, companies are hiring and people are spending. Don’t readily believe everything that you hear. No, I’m not advocating a doom-and-gloom narrative. However, there’s some evidence that a rotation out of the usual suspects – typically…

    "sameAs": [                "https:\/\/twitter.com\/EnomotoMedia"            ]        }    ],    "headline": "7 High-Quality Blue-Chip Stocks to Buy if You're Looking for Stability",    "datePublished": "2024-03-12T15:41:22-04:00",    "dateModified": "2024-03-12T15:41:29-04:00",    "image": {        "@type": "ImageObject",        "url": "https:\/\/investorplace.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2019\/07\/blue-chip-money.jpg",        "height": 900,        "width": 1600    },    "articleBody": "Costco (COST): Embrace Costco's resilient retail model, offering consistent growth and defense against economic downturns. McDonald's (MCD): Ride McDonald's fast-food success with its affordable dining options and strategic initiatives. Deere (DE): Invest in Deere's agricultural leadership and potential political catalysts. Dive into these blue-chip stocks for a greater degree of confidence. At first glance, a concerted focus on stable blue-chip stocks might seem excessively cautious. After all, the market is booming, companies are hiring and people are spending. Don't readily believe everything that you hear. No, I'm not advocating a doom-and-gloom narrative. However, there's some evidence that a rotation out of the usual suspects - typically technology-related - is occurring, leading to other entities to play catch up. Yes, seemingly everyone loves artificial intelligence and what not. But this space may be getting too hot. On the other hand, some very reliable businesses just aren't getting the attention they deserve. But based on market and economic undercurrents, the big dogs might thrive. With that, here are some intriguing blue-chip stocks to consider. Costco (COST) Source: ilzesgimene \/ Shutterstock.comA membership-only big-box retailer, Costco (NASDAQ:COST) in my opinion mainly benefits from the implied resilience of its core customer group. Basically, the company caters to relatively young, educated and upwardly mobile households. Under difficult circumstances, COST should be insulated compared to much of the competition. Therefore, it seems an intriguing idea for blue-chip stocks. Notably, COST stock is also priced at a discount. Recently, the company's shares suffered red ink as the business missed sales estimates for its latest earnings disclosure. However, investors shouldn't miss the forest for the trees. By the end of this fiscal year, Costco should generate revenue of $254.5 billion. That would take it 5% above last year's tally of $242.29 billion. Looking out to 2025, analysts believe revenue will land at $272.1 billion. If so, that would imply a 6.9% jump from 2024's projected sales. Again, because Costco caters to higher-income shoppers, it wouldn't be surprising to see the company hit the higher end of analysts expectations. In that case, we'd be looking at 2024 sales of $260.62 billion and 2025 sales of $288.16 billion. McDonald’s (MCD) Source: Vytautas Kielaitis \/ ShutterstockOne of the world's most famous blue-chip stocks, McDonald's (NYSE:MCD) reigns supreme over the fast-food industry. Fundamentally, McDonald's should continue benefiting from its cheap eats business model. Not only that, but the company's pivot to its coffee-and-other-beverages-focused brand CosMc should be intriguing. As society fully normalizes from the pandemic, CosMc should help bolster the growth narrative. Speaking of which, Yahoo Finance points out that analysts believe that by the end of this fiscal year, sales will hit $26.89 billion. That would imply 5.5% growth from last year's haul of $25.49 billion. Turning to fiscal year 2025, revenue may reach $28.51 billion. If so, we would be talking about a 6% increase over 2024's projected top line. On the profitability front, earnings per share in 2024 should be $12.44, above the $11.94 posted in 2023. And in 2025, analysts are anticipating EPS of $13.57. Lastly, covering experts peg MCD shares a consensus moderate buy with a $323.24 average price target. The high-side estimate calls for $357. Combined with its 2.18% dividend yield, McDonald's makes for one of the top blue-chip stocks. Deere (DE) Source: Jim Lambert \/ Shutterstock.comAs an agricultural industry giant, Deere (NYSE:DE) represents one of the most important blue-chip stocks. Basically, it's an indirect but essential component of the broader food supply chain. Not only that, DE may enjoy a political catalyst. With political rumblings suggesting that the 2024 election could be tighter than expected, Deere could be a top beneficiary. Late last year, President Joe Biden announced over $5 billion in new investments. A good chunk of that will go toward climate-smart agriculture. In addition to Biden's concerns about water, Deere could indirectly benefit. After all, the company's equipment could play a role in agricultural and water management-related endeavors. However, DE stock has underperformed over the past year and that's partially due to poor sales expectations. In 2024, analysts anticipate revenue to land at $47.88 billion, down almost 14% from last year. However, the high-side also calls for $54 billion, which would greatly mitigate the red ink. Overall, covering experts rate DE a consensus moderate buy with a $420.94 average price target. The high-side target calls for $483, implying bullishness that belies the current underperformance in the market. Kenvue (KVUE) Source: Giovanni Nastukov \/ Shutterstock.comWhen it comes to blue-chip stocks that can ride out anxieties, I'd turn to Kenvue (NYSE:KVUE). Technically, KVUE entered the public domain last year, making it a \"new\" tradable entity. However, it was spun off from Johnson & Johnson (NYSE:JNJ), which now focuses on pharmaceuticals and medical technology. On the other hand, Kenvue now operates the consumer healthcare products division. Frankly, this business might be more compelling. Under difficult economic conditions, people might not have access to the best healthcare solutions. However, anyone can reasonably afford over-the-counter medication and other personal care solutions. Plus, not everybody requires the most rigorous medical solutions but everyone has suffered the occasional headache or papercut. That's where Kenvue comes into play. By the end of this fiscal year, analysts believe sales will reach $15.66 billion. That doesn't call for much growth over last year's sales of $15.44 billion. However, by 2025, the top line could rise to $16.22 billion. They also peg shares as a consensus moderate buy with a $22.78 average price target. Kenvue also pays a dividend with a 3.06% yield, making KVUE one of the more intriguing blue-chip stocks. Microsoft (MSFT) Source: The Art of Pics \/ Shutterstock.comOne of the most powerful technology companies in the world, Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT) needs no introduction. Recently, the company has been generating headlines for its investments in artificial intelligence. Clearly, they've been paying off quite handsomely. However, Microsoft symbolizes one of the blue-chip stocks to buy for long-term stability because it's the lifeblood of business. When things need to get done in the real world, whether they be reports or spreadsheets or presentations, they're done on Microsoft programs. I'd argue that they've become part of the collective digital DNA. And since that's what everyone else uses, being fluent in Microsoft is an essential component of business (and academic) success. By the end of this year, the consensus calls for revenue to hit $244.29 billion. That's a 15.3 jump from last year's print of $211.91 billion. Given the company's vast footprint, that doesn't seem an unreasonable target. For 2025, sales may reach $279.31 billion or 14.3% up from projected 2024 revenue. Covering experts rate MSFT a consensus strong buy with a $469.34 average price target. Notably, the high-side target calls for $600. Chevron (CVX) Source: Sundry Photography \/ Shutterstock.comAn oil and gas giant, Chevron (NYSE:CVX) will probably incur some impact from the 2024 elections. Obviously, if the Republicans take power, their penchant for supporting hydrocarbons may be more beneficial to CVX stock. However, given broader geopolitical realities, I believe the Democrats must adopt a more realistic, nuanced approach to fossil fuels. So, either way, Chevron could be a winner. Granted, that doesn't align with prevailing sentiment. For example, analysts believe that by the end of this fiscal year, revenue will come in at $200.79 billion. That would be slightly below parity against last year's print of $200.95 billion. However, the high-side estimate calls for sales to reach $246.34 billion, implying almost 23% year-over-year growth. It's possible that the truth could land somewhere in the middle. As the global community fully normalizes from the Covid-19 crisis, it's likely that hydrocarbon demand will increase. Also, electric vehicles haven't really looked so hot these days. Experts peg shares as a moderate buy with a $176.63 price target. Combined with its dividend yield of 4.15%, CVX is one of the blue-chip stocks to buy. UnitedHealth (UNH) Source: Ken Wolter \/ Shutterstock.comTo be completely upfront, the bullish case for UnitedHealth (NYSE:UNH) seems risky. Late last month, The Wall Street Journal reported that the U.S. Department of Justice launched an antitrust investigation into the company. Basically, there are concerns about UnitedHealth's insurance unit and its Optum health services arm, which owns physician groups among other assets. As a result, UNH stock has underperformed significantly. Nevertheless, looking ahead, the fallout could represent an undervalued opportunity. I don't want to say the business is too big to fail but it plays a major role in the broader healthcare industry. Also, the aging and sizable baby boomer population presents a massive total addressable market. For 2024, experts project sales to reach just over $401 billion, about 8% higher than last year's tally of $371.62 billion. By the end of 2025, revenue may land at over $432 billion. That would be 7.7% above 2024's projected top line. Finally, covering analysts rate UNH a consensus strong buy with a $591.29 average price target. The high side calls for $675, making it one of the compelling blue-chip stocks to consider. On the date of publication, Josh Enomoto did not have (either directly or indirectly) any positions in the securities mentioned in this article. The opinions expressed in this article are those of the writer, subject to the InvestorPlace.com Publishing Guidelines. Stability	</h1>	<div class="entry-meta byline -no-tagline">					<p class="article-subtitle post-title1">			Watch the rotation		</p>					<div class="entry-meta byline">												<span class="bullet-points">								<ul><li><strong>Costco</strong> (<a class="ipm-ticker-link" href="https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/cost-stock-quote/"><strong>COST</strong></a>): Embrace Costco’s resilient retail model, offering consistent growth and defense against economic downturns.</li><li><strong>McDonald’s</strong> (<a class="ipm-ticker-link" href="https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/mcd-stock-quote/"><strong>MCD</strong></a>): Ride McDonald’s fast-food success with its affordable dining options and strategic initiatives.</li><li><strong>Deere</strong> (<a class="ipm-ticker-link" href="https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/de-stock-quote/"><strong>DE</strong></a>): Invest in Deere’s agricultural leadership and potential political catalysts.</li><li>Dive into these blue-chip stocks for a greater degree of confidence.</li></ul>							</div>							<div class="ad-wrapper"></div>														<figure class="entry-featured-image">			<div>				<img width="768" height="432" src="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/blue-chip-money-768x432.jpg" class="attachment-medium_large size-medium_large wp-post-image" alt="Blue-Chip Stocks - 7 High-Quality Blue-Chip Stocks to Buy if You’re Looking for Stability" decoding="async" srcset="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/blue-chip-money-768x432.jpg 768w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/blue-chip-money-300x169.jpg 300w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/blue-chip-money-1024x576.jpg 1024w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/blue-chip-money-200x113.jpg 200w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/blue-chip-money-400x225.jpg 400w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/blue-chip-money-116x65.jpg 116w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/blue-chip-money-100x56.jpg 100w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/blue-chip-money-89x50.jpg 89w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/blue-chip-money-78x44.jpg 78w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/blue-chip-money.jpg 1600w" sizes="(max-width: 768px) 100vw, 768px" />			</div>							<figcaption>																<p class="source">Source: Shutterstock</p>									</figcaption>					</figure>							<div class="entry-content story">							<p>At first glance, a concerted focus on stable <a class="auto-linked-term" href="https://investorplace.com/stock-types/blue-chip-stocks/">blue-chip stocks</a> might seem excessively cautious. After all, the market is booming, companies are hiring and people are spending. Don’t readily believe everything that you hear.</p><p>No, I’m not advocating a doom-and-gloom narrative. However, there’s some evidence that a <a href="https://www.forbes.com/sites/moneyshow/2024/03/09/rotation-nation-as-mag-7-fade-other-stocks-bitcoin--gold-rise/?sh=59dada1b15f5" rel="nofollow">rotation</a> out of the usual suspects – typically technology-related – is occurring, leading to other entities to play catch up. Yes, seemingly everyone loves artificial intelligence and what not. But this space may be getting too hot.</p><p>On the other hand, some very reliable businesses just aren’t getting the attention they deserve. But based on market and economic undercurrents, the big dogs might thrive. With that, here are some intriguing blue-chip stocks to consider.</p><h2 class="wp-block-heading">Costco (COST)</h2><div id="1568845" class="wp-caption alignright"><img src="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/plugins/lazy-load/images/1x1.trans.gif" data-lazy-src="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/cost1600-300x169.jpg" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="300" height="169" alt="A Costco Wholesale (COST) warehouse in Auburn Hills, Michigan." class="alignright wp-image-1568845" srcset="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/cost1600-300x169.jpg 300w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/cost1600-1024x576.jpg 1024w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/cost1600-768x432.jpg 768w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/cost1600-1536x864.jpg 1536w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/cost1600-200x113.jpg 200w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/cost1600-400x225.jpg 400w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/cost1600-116x65.jpg 116w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/cost1600-100x56.jpg 100w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/cost1600-89x50.jpg 89w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/cost1600-78x44.jpg 78w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/cost1600.jpg 1600w" sizes="(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px"><div class="ipm_image_source">Source: ilzesgimene / Shutterstock.com</div></div><p>A membership-only big-box retailer, <strong>Costco</strong> (NASDAQ:<a class="ipm-ticker-link" href="https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/cost-stock-quote/"><strong>COST</strong></a>) in my opinion mainly benefits from the implied resilience of its core customer group. Basically, the company caters to relatively young, educated and upwardly mobile households. Under difficult circumstances, COST should be insulated compared to much of the competition. Therefore, it seems an intriguing idea for blue-chip stocks.</p><p>Notably, COST stock is also priced at a discount. Recently, the company’s shares suffered red ink as the business <a href="https://www.wsj.com/livecoverage/stock-market-today-dow-jones-03-08-2024/card/costco-stock-drops-after-sales-miss-estimates-fee-hike-stays-on-ice-fanfZdtPmx5e41o1asRl" rel="nofollow">missed sales estimates</a> for its latest earnings disclosure. However, investors shouldn’t miss the forest for the trees. By the end of this fiscal year, Costco <a href="https://finance.yahoo.com/quote/COST/analysis" rel="nofollow">should generate revenue of $254.5 billion</a>. That would take it 5% above last year’s tally of $242.29 billion.</p><p>Looking out to 2025, analysts believe revenue will land at $272.1 billion. If so, that would imply a 6.9% jump from 2024’s projected sales. Again, because Costco caters to higher-income shoppers, it wouldn’t be surprising to see the company hit the higher end of analysts expectations.</p><p>In that case, we’d be looking at 2024 sales of $260.62 billion and 2025 sales of $288.16 billion.</p><h2 class="wp-block-heading">McDonald’s (MCD)</h2><div id="2269070" class="wp-caption alignright"><img src="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/plugins/lazy-load/images/1x1.trans.gif" data-lazy-src="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/07/mcd-1600-1-300x169.jpg" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="300" height="169" alt="McDonald's golden arches" class="alignright wp-image-2269070" srcset="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/07/mcd-1600-1-300x169.jpg 300w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/07/mcd-1600-1-1024x576.jpg 1024w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/07/mcd-1600-1-768x432.jpg 768w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/07/mcd-1600-1-1536x864.jpg 1536w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/07/mcd-1600-1-200x113.jpg 200w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/07/mcd-1600-1-400x225.jpg 400w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/07/mcd-1600-1-116x65.jpg 116w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/07/mcd-1600-1-100x56.jpg 100w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/07/mcd-1600-1-89x50.jpg 89w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/07/mcd-1600-1-78x44.jpg 78w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/07/mcd-1600-1.jpg 1600w" sizes="(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px"><div class="ipm_image_source">Source: Vytautas Kielaitis / Shutterstock</div></div><p>One of the world’s most famous blue-chip stocks, <strong>McDonald’s</strong> (NYSE:<a class="ipm-ticker-link" href="https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/mcd-stock-quote/"><strong>MCD</strong></a>) reigns supreme over the fast-food industry. Fundamentally, McDonald’s should continue benefiting from its cheap eats business model. Not only that, but the company’s pivot to its <a href="https://www.cbsnews.com/news/mcdonalds-cosmcs-locations-near-me-bolingbrook-illinois-starbucks/#:~:text=McDonald's%20said%20it%20is%20opening,seeks%20to%20boost%20afternoon%20sales." rel="nofollow">coffee-and-other-beverages-focused brand</a> CosMc should be intriguing. As society fully normalizes from the pandemic, CosMc should help bolster the growth narrative.</p><p>Speaking of which, Yahoo Finance points out that analysts believe that by the end of this fiscal year, sales will hit $26.89 billion. That would imply 5.5% growth from last year’s haul of $25.49 billion. Turning to fiscal year 2025, revenue may reach $28.51 billion. If so, we would be talking about a 6% increase over 2024’s projected top line.</p><p>On the profitability front, earnings per share in 2024 should be $12.44, above the $11.94 posted in 2023. And in 2025, analysts are anticipating EPS of $13.57.</p><p>Lastly, covering experts peg MCD shares a <a href="https://www.tipranks.com/stocks/mcd/forecast" rel="nofollow">consensus moderate buy</a> with a $323.24 average price target. The high-side estimate calls for $357. Combined with its 2.18% dividend yield, McDonald’s makes for one of the top blue-chip stocks.</p><h2 class="wp-block-heading">Deere (DE)</h2><div id="1964171" class="wp-caption alignright"><img src="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/plugins/lazy-load/images/1x1.trans.gif" data-lazy-src="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/de_deere_1600-300x169.jpg" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="300" height="169" alt="Several John Deere vehicles are parked outside of a building." class="alignright wp-image-1964171" srcset="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/de_deere_1600-300x169.jpg 300w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/de_deere_1600-1024x576.jpg 1024w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/de_deere_1600-768x432.jpg 768w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/de_deere_1600-1536x864.jpg 1536w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/de_deere_1600-200x113.jpg 200w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/de_deere_1600-400x225.jpg 400w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/de_deere_1600-116x65.jpg 116w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/de_deere_1600-100x56.jpg 100w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/de_deere_1600-89x50.jpg 89w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/de_deere_1600-78x44.jpg 78w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/de_deere_1600.jpg 1600w" sizes="(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px"><div class="ipm_image_source">Source: Jim Lambert / Shutterstock.com</div></div><p>As an agricultural industry giant, <strong>Deere</strong> (NYSE:<a class="ipm-ticker-link" href="https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/de-stock-quote/"><strong>DE</strong></a>) represents one of the most important blue-chip stocks. Basically, it’s an indirect but essential component of the broader food supply chain. Not only that, DE may enjoy a political catalyst. With political rumblings suggesting that the 2024 election could be tighter than expected, Deere could be a top beneficiary.</p><p>Late last year, President Joe Biden announced over $5 billion in new investments. A good chunk of that will go toward <a href="https://www.usda.gov/media/press-releases/2023/11/01/president-biden-announces-over-5-billion-support-rural-communities#:~:text=%241.7%20Billion%20in%20Investments%20in,environmental%20co%2Dbenefits%2C%20and%20offer" rel="nofollow">climate-smart agriculture</a>. In addition to Biden’s concerns about water, Deere could indirectly benefit. After all, the company’s equipment could play a role in agricultural and water management-related endeavors.</p><p>However, DE stock has underperformed over the past year and that’s partially due to poor sales expectations. In 2024, analysts anticipate revenue to land at $47.88 billion, down almost 14% from last year. However, the high-side also calls for $54 billion, which would greatly mitigate the red ink.</p><p>Overall, covering experts rate DE a <a href="https://www.tipranks.com/stocks/de/forecast" rel="nofollow">consensus moderate buy</a> with a $420.94 average price target. The high-side target calls for $483, implying bullishness that belies the current underperformance in the market.</p><h2 class="wp-block-heading">Kenvue (KVUE)</h2><div id="2364451" class="wp-caption alignright"><img src="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/plugins/lazy-load/images/1x1.trans.gif" data-lazy-src="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/05/kvue1600-300x169.png" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="300" height="169" alt="Albuquerque, New Mexico / USA - November 2 2020: Boxes of Band-Aids in Walmart in the pharmacy and over-the-counter medication aisle. Kenvue (KVUE) split from JNJ and now owns the Band-aid brand." class="alignright wp-image-2364451" srcset="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/05/kvue1600-300x169.png 300w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/05/kvue1600-1024x576.png 1024w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/05/kvue1600-768x432.png 768w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/05/kvue1600-1536x864.png 1536w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/05/kvue1600-200x113.png 200w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/05/kvue1600-400x225.png 400w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/05/kvue1600-116x65.png 116w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/05/kvue1600-100x56.png 100w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/05/kvue1600-89x50.png 89w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/05/kvue1600-78x44.png 78w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/05/kvue1600.png 1600w" sizes="(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px"><div class="ipm_image_source">Source:  Giovanni Nastukov / Shutterstock.com</div></div><p>When it comes to blue-chip stocks that can ride out anxieties, I’d turn to <strong>Kenvue</strong> (NYSE:<a class="ipm-ticker-link" href="https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/kvue-stock-quote/"><strong>KVUE</strong></a>). Technically, KVUE entered the public domain last year, making it a “new” tradable entity. However, it was spun off from <strong>Johnson & Johnson</strong> (NYSE:<a class="ipm-ticker-link" href="https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/jnj-stock-quote/"><strong>JNJ</strong></a>), which now focuses on pharmaceuticals and medical technology. On the other hand, Kenvue now operates the consumer healthcare products division. Frankly, this business might be more compelling.</p><p>Under difficult economic conditions, people might not have access to the best healthcare solutions. However, anyone can reasonably afford over-the-counter medication and other personal care solutions. Plus, not everybody requires the most rigorous medical solutions but everyone has suffered the occasional headache or papercut. That’s where Kenvue comes into play.</p><p>By the end of this fiscal year, analysts believe sales will reach $15.66 billion. That doesn’t call for much growth over last year’s sales of $15.44 billion. However, by 2025, the top line could rise to $16.22 billion.</p><p>They also peg shares as a <a href="https://www.tipranks.com/stocks/kvue/forecast" rel="nofollow">consensus moderate buy</a> with a $22.78 average price target. Kenvue also pays a dividend with a <a href="https://www.tipranks.com/stocks/kvue/dividends" rel="nofollow">3.06% yield</a>, making KVUE one of the more intriguing blue-chip stocks.</p><h2 class="wp-block-heading">Microsoft (MSFT)</h2><div id="2459325" class="wp-caption alignright"><img src="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/plugins/lazy-load/images/1x1.trans.gif" data-lazy-src="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/10/msft1600-1-300x169.png" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="300" height="169" alt="Microsoft logo close up. Microsoft (MSFT) Flagship Store Fifth Avenue, Manhattan, NYC." class="alignright wp-image-2459325" srcset="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/10/msft1600-1-300x169.png 300w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/10/msft1600-1-1024x576.png 1024w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/10/msft1600-1-768x432.png 768w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/10/msft1600-1-1536x864.png 1536w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/10/msft1600-1-200x113.png 200w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/10/msft1600-1-400x225.png 400w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/10/msft1600-1-116x65.png 116w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/10/msft1600-1-100x56.png 100w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/10/msft1600-1-89x50.png 89w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/10/msft1600-1-78x44.png 78w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/10/msft1600-1.png 1600w" sizes="(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px"><div class="ipm_image_source">Source: The Art of Pics / Shutterstock.com</div></div><p>One of the most powerful technology companies in the world, <strong>Microsoft</strong> (NASDAQ:<a class="ipm-ticker-link" href="https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/msft-stock-quote/"><strong>MSFT</strong></a>) needs no introduction. Recently, the company has been generating headlines for its investments in artificial intelligence. Clearly, they’ve been paying off quite handsomely. However, Microsoft symbolizes one of the blue-chip stocks to buy for long-term stability because it’s the lifeblood of business.</p><p>When things need to get done in the real world, whether they be reports or spreadsheets or presentations, they’re done on Microsoft programs. I’d argue that they’ve become part of the collective digital DNA. And since that’s what everyone else uses, being fluent in Microsoft is an essential component of business (and academic) success.</p><p>By the end of this year, the consensus calls for revenue to hit $244.29 billion. That’s a 15.3 jump from last year’s print of $211.91 billion. Given the company’s vast footprint, that doesn’t seem an unreasonable target. For 2025, sales may reach $279.31 billion or 14.3% up from projected 2024 revenue.</p><p>Covering experts rate MSFT a <a href="https://www.tipranks.com/stocks/msft/forecast" rel="nofollow">consensus strong buy</a> with a $469.34 average price target. Notably, the high-side target calls for $600.</p><h2 class="wp-block-heading">Chevron (CVX)</h2><div id="1444771" class="wp-caption alignright"><img src="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/plugins/lazy-load/images/1x1.trans.gif" data-lazy-src="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/cvx-stock-6-300x169.jpg" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="300" height="169" alt='Chevron (CVX) logo on gas station sign with "diesel" and "food mart" written underneath' class="alignright wp-image-1444771" srcset="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/cvx-stock-6-300x169.jpg 300w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/cvx-stock-6-768x432.jpg 768w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/cvx-stock-6-1024x576.jpg 1024w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/cvx-stock-6-200x113.jpg 200w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/cvx-stock-6-400x225.jpg 400w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/cvx-stock-6-116x65.jpg 116w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/cvx-stock-6-100x56.jpg 100w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/cvx-stock-6-89x50.jpg 89w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/cvx-stock-6-78x44.jpg 78w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/cvx-stock-6.jpg 1600w" sizes="(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px"><div class="ipm_image_source">Source: Sundry Photography / Shutterstock.com</div></div><p>An oil and gas giant, <strong>Chevron</strong> (NYSE:<a class="ipm-ticker-link" href="https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/cvx-stock-quote/"><strong>CVX</strong></a>) will probably incur some impact from the 2024 elections. Obviously, if the Republicans take power, their penchant for supporting hydrocarbons may be more beneficial to CVX stock. However, given broader geopolitical realities, I believe the Democrats must adopt a more realistic, nuanced approach to fossil fuels. So, either way, Chevron could be a winner.</p><p>Granted, that doesn’t align with prevailing sentiment. For example, analysts believe that by the end of this fiscal year, revenue will come in at $200.79 billion. That would be slightly below parity against last year’s print of $200.95 billion. However, the high-side estimate calls for sales to reach $246.34 billion, implying almost 23% year-over-year growth.</p><p>It’s possible that the truth could land somewhere in the middle. As the global community fully normalizes from the Covid-19 crisis, it’s likely that hydrocarbon demand will increase. Also, electric vehicles haven’t really looked so hot these days.</p><p>Experts peg shares as a <a href="https://www.tipranks.com/stocks/cvx" rel="nofollow">moderate buy</a> with a $176.63 price target. Combined with its <a href="https://www.tipranks.com/stocks/cvx/dividends" rel="nofollow">dividend yield</a> of 4.15%, CVX is one of the blue-chip stocks to buy.</p><h2 class="wp-block-heading">UnitedHealth (UNH)</h2><div id="1403703" class="wp-caption alignright"><img src="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/plugins/lazy-load/images/1x1.trans.gif" data-lazy-src="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/unh1600-300x169.jpg" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="300" height="169" alt="The UnitedHealth (UNH) headquarters in Minnetonka, Minnesota." class="alignright wp-image-1403703" srcset="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/unh1600-300x169.jpg 300w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/unh1600-768x432.jpg 768w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/unh1600-1024x576.jpg 1024w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/unh1600-200x113.jpg 200w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/unh1600-400x225.jpg 400w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/unh1600-116x65.jpg 116w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/unh1600-100x56.jpg 100w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/unh1600-89x50.jpg 89w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/unh1600-78x44.jpg 78w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/unh1600.jpg 1600w" sizes="(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px"><div class="ipm_image_source">Source: Ken Wolter / Shutterstock.com</div></div><p>To be completely upfront, the bullish case for <strong>UnitedHealth</strong> (NYSE:<a class="ipm-ticker-link" href="https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/unh-stock-quote/"><strong>UNH</strong></a>) seems risky. Late last month, <em>The Wall Street Journal</em> reported that the U.S. Department of Justice launched an <a href="https://www.reuters.com/business/healthcare-pharmaceuticals/us-launches-antitrust-investigation-into-unitedhealth-wsj-reports-2024-02-27/" rel="nofollow">antitrust investigation</a> into the company. Basically, there are concerns about UnitedHealth’s insurance unit and its Optum health services arm, which owns physician groups among other assets.</p><p>As a result, UNH stock has underperformed significantly. Nevertheless, looking ahead, the fallout could represent an undervalued opportunity. I don’t want to say the business is too big to fail but it plays a major role in the broader healthcare industry. Also, the aging and sizable baby boomer population presents a massive total addressable market.</p><p>For 2024, experts project sales to reach just over $401 billion, about 8% higher than last year’s tally of $371.62 billion. By the end of 2025, revenue may land at over $432 billion. That would be 7.7% above 2024’s projected top line.</p><p>Finally, covering analysts rate UNH a <a href="https://www.tipranks.com/stocks/unh/forecast" rel="nofollow">consensus strong buy</a> with a $591.29 average price target. The high side calls for $675, making it one of the compelling blue-chip stocks to consider.</p><p><em>On the date of publication, Josh Enomoto</em><em> did not have (either directly or indirectly) any positions in the securities mentioned in this article. </em><em>The opinions expressed in this article are those of the writer, subject to the InvestorPlace.com </em><a href="https://investorplace.com/corporate/investorplace-publishing-guidelines/" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener"><em>Publishing Guidelines</em></a><em>.</em><em></em></p><div class="ipm-author-short-bio"><p>A former senior business analyst for Sony Electronics, Josh Enomoto has helped broker major contracts with Fortune Global 500 companies. articles.title: 3 Cloud Computing Stocks to Buy for Long-Term Growth
summarizedBulletPoints: - The cloud computing industry is projected to grow at a CAGR of 16.40% until 2029, with significant players like Amazon, Microsoft, and Alphabet set to benefit.

- **Amazon** (AMZN): Amazon Web Services (AWS) has been a key player in the cloud computing industry since 2006, continuing to achieve double-digit year-over-year revenue growth. AWS reached $24.3 billion in revenue in the fourth quarter of 2023, contributing significantly to Amazon's overall sales. The company also focuses on AI to enhance its cloud computing platform.

- **Microsoft** (MSFT): Microsoft Azure, launched in 2010, forms the foundation of Microsoft Cloud, which generated $33.7 billion in Q2 FY24 revenue, marking a 24% year-over-year increase. Microsoft has diversified its portfolio to include AI, LinkedIn, Bing, Xbox, and others, positioning it as a consistent growth stock in the market.

- **Alphabet** (GOOG, GOOGL): Since its inception in 2008, Google Cloud has been instrumental in driving Alphabet's revenue acceleration. The fourth quarter earnings report highlighted a 13% year-over-year revenue increase for Alphabet, with Google Cloud's revenue jumping from $7.3 billion in Q4 2022 to $9.2 billion in Q4 2023, a 26% increase. Google Cloud also turned a net profit, improving Alphabet's net profit margins.
articles.desc: The cloud computing industry has a projected 16.40% CAGR until 2029. These cloud computing stocks will benefit.

"2024-03-12T16:27:46-04:00",    "dateModified": "2024-03-12T16:27:55-04:00",    "image": {        "@type": "ImageObject",        "url": "https:\/\/investorplace.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2019\/07\/cloud1600c.jpg",        "height": 900,        "width": 1600    },    "articleBody": "The cloud computing industry is projected to grow at 16.40% annually until 2029. These three stocks stand to benefit. Amazon\u00a0(AMZN): Amazon Web Services continues to achieve double-digit year-over-year revenue growth. Microsoft\u00a0(MSFT): Azure has been a game changer that continues to deliver profits. Alphabet\u00a0(GOOG, GOOGL): Revenue acceleration remains strong for Google Cloud, and profits are up too. The cloud computing industry still has plenty of growth potential. The sector is projected to grow at a compounded annual growth rate of 16.40% from now until 2029. Many corporations that operate in this vertical have expanded their profit margins and stand to generate higher earnings thanks to scalability. Investors can choose from several cloud computing stocks. Many investments in this sector have outperformed the stock market, but these are some of the top picks to consider. Amazon (AMZN) Source: Tada Images \/ Shutterstock.comAmazon (NASDAQ:AMZN) was an early entrant in the cloud computing industry thanks to Amazon Web Services. The tech giant launched its highly profitable growth driver in 2006. Even with a large percentage of market share and billions of dollars in quarterly revenue, AWS still exhibits double-digit growth rates. Amazon Web Services revenue reached $24.3 billion in the fourth quarter of 2023. The 13% year-over-year increase represents a respectable segment of the company's $170.0 billion in total net sales. The company, as a whole, achieved 14% year-over-year growth on its top line. Amazon is tapping into artificial intelligence (AI) to strengthen its cloud computing platform. The company's massive head start and large customer base suggest Amazon can continue to march forward. Online marketplace sales are still growing, and the company reported a record-breaking Q4 holiday shopping season. Amazon stock is up by 91% over the past year and has more than doubled over the past five years.  Microsoft (MSFT) Source: Asif Islam \/ Shutterstock.comMicrosoft (NASDAQ:MSFT) is another leader in the cloud computing industry with a long history. The company unveiled Azure in 2010. Since then, it's become one of the company's most important sources of revenue and profits. Azure is the foundation for the Microsoft Cloud category. The business segment generated $33.7 billion in Q2 FY24 revenue, representing a 24% year-over-year increase. The corporation overall delivered 18% year-over-year revenue growth and 33% year-over-year net income growth.  Cloud computing isn't the company's only specialty. Recent investments in AI have panned out nicely and positioned Microsoft as a leader in the industry. The company also owns LinkedIn, Bing, Xbox and other entities. The company has exposure to many verticals and the financial might and leadership to tap into new opportunities.  Microsoft has been one of the most consistent growth stocks in the market. Shares are up by 64% over the past year and 248% over the past five years.  Alphabet (GOOG, GOOGL) Source: IgorGolovniov \/ Shutterstock.comSome investors like to find smaller companies that offer more long-term upside. However, this list demonstrates that you can still get great returns from tech giants specializing in the cloud computing industry.  Alphabet’s (NASDAQ:GOOG, NASDAQ:GOOGL) shares are up by more than 50% over the past year and have gained 135% over the past five years. Google Cloud has been a focal point of revenue acceleration and has been around since 2008. The company's fourth-quarter earnings report highlighted a broad recovery in the advertising market. Alphabet's revenue increased by 13% year-over-year, while net income jumped by more than 50% year-over-year.  Google Cloud was a big reason for the company's financial success. Its revenue jumped from $7.3 billion in Q4 2022 to $9.2 billion in Q4 2023. That’s a 26% year-over-year increase. Google Cloud also flipped a net loss into a net profit, resulting in higher net profit margins moving forward. On this date of publication, Marc Guberti held long positions in MSFT and GOOG. The opinions expressed in this article are those of the writer, subject to the InvestorPlace.com Publishing Guidelines. Marc Guberti is a finance freelance writer at InvestorPlace.com who hosts the Breakthrough Success Podcast. These three stocks stand to benefit.</span></li><li><strong><span data-preserver-spaces="true">Amazon</span></strong><span data-preserver-spaces="true"> (</span><strong><a href="https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/amzn-stock-quote/"><strong><u>AMZN</u></strong></a></strong><span data-preserver-spaces="true">): Amazon Web Services continues to achieve double-digit year-over-year revenue growth.</span></li><li><strong><span data-preserver-spaces="true">Microsoft</span></strong><span data-preserver-spaces="true"> (</span><strong><a href="https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/msft-stock-quote/"><strong><u>MSFT</u></strong></a></strong><span data-preserver-spaces="true">): Azure has been a game changer that continues to deliver profits.</span></li><li><strong><span data-preserver-spaces="true">Alphabet</span></strong><span data-preserver-spaces="true"> (<span class="stock-ticker"><a href="https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/goog-stock-quote/"><strong><u>GOOG</u></strong></a></span>, <span class="stock-ticker"><a href="https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/googl-stock-quote/"><strong><u>GOOGL</u></strong></a></span>): Revenue acceleration remains strong for Google Cloud, and profits are up too.</span></li></ul>							</div>							<div class="ad-wrapper"></div>														<figure class="entry-featured-image">			<div>				<img width="768" height="432" src="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/cloud1600c-768x432.jpg" class="attachment-medium_large size-medium_large wp-post-image" alt="cloud computing stocks - 3 Cloud Computing Stocks to Buy for Long-Term Growth" decoding="async" srcset="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/cloud1600c-768x432.jpg 768w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/cloud1600c-300x169.jpg 300w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/cloud1600c-1024x576.jpg 1024w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/cloud1600c-200x113.jpg 200w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/cloud1600c-400x225.jpg 400w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/cloud1600c-116x65.jpg 116w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/cloud1600c-100x56.jpg 100w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/cloud1600c-89x50.jpg 89w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/cloud1600c-78x44.jpg 78w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/cloud1600c.jpg 1600w" sizes="(max-width: 768px) 100vw, 768px" />			</div>							<figcaption>																<p class="source">Source: Shutterstock</p>									</figcaption>					</figure>							<div class="entry-content story">							<p>The cloud computing industry still has plenty of growth potential. The sector is projected to grow at a compounded annual growth rate of 16.40% <a href="https://www.mordorintelligence.com/industry-reports/cloud-computing-market#:~:text=The%20Cloud%20Computing%20Market%20size,period%20(2024-2029)." rel="nofollow">from now until 2029.</a> Many corporations that operate in this vertical have expanded their profit margins and stand to generate higher earnings thanks to scalability.</p><p>Investors can choose from several cloud computing stocks. Many investments in this sector have outperformed the stock market, but these are some of the top picks to consider.</p><h2 class="wp-block-heading"><strong>Amazon (AMZN)</strong></h2><div id="2203114" class="wp-caption alignright"><img src="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/plugins/lazy-load/images/1x1.trans.gif" data-lazy-src="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/amzn_amazon_2_1600-300x169.png" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="300" height="169" alt="Closeup of the Amazon logo at Amazon campus in Palo Alto, California. The Palo Alto location hosts A9 Search, Amazon Web Services, and Amazon Game Studios teams. AMZN stock" class="alignright wp-image-2203114" srcset="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/amzn_amazon_2_1600-300x169.png 300w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/amzn_amazon_2_1600-1024x576.png 1024w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/amzn_amazon_2_1600-768x432.png 768w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/amzn_amazon_2_1600-1536x864.png 1536w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/amzn_amazon_2_1600-200x113.png 200w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/amzn_amazon_2_1600-400x225.png 400w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/amzn_amazon_2_1600-116x65.png 116w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/amzn_amazon_2_1600-100x56.png 100w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/amzn_amazon_2_1600-89x50.png 89w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/amzn_amazon_2_1600-78x44.png 78w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/amzn_amazon_2_1600.png 1600w" sizes="(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px"><div class="ipm_image_source">Source: Tada Images / Shutterstock.com</div></div><p><strong>Amazon</strong> (NASDAQ:<span class="stock-ticker"><a href="https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/amzn-stock-quote/"><strong><u>AMZN</u></strong></a></span>) was an early entrant in the cloud computing industry thanks to Amazon Web Services. The tech giant launched its highly profitable growth driver in 2006. Even with a large percentage of market share and billions of dollars in quarterly revenue, AWS still exhibits double-digit growth rates.</p><p>Amazon Web Services revenue <a href="https://ir.aboutamazon.com/news-release/news-release-details/2024/Amazon.com-Announces-Fourth-Quarter-Results/" rel="nofollow">reached $24.3 billion</a> in the fourth quarter of 2023. The 13% year-over-year increase represents a respectable segment of the company’s $170.0 billion in total net sales. The company, as a whole, achieved 14% year-over-year growth on its top line.</p><p>Amazon is tapping into artificial intelligence (<a class="ipm-ticker-link" href="https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/ai-stock-quote/"><strong>AI</strong></a>) to strengthen its cloud computing platform. The company’s massive head start and large customer base suggest Amazon can continue to march forward. Online marketplace sales are still growing, and the company reported a record-breaking Q4 holiday shopping season.</p><p>Amazon stock is up by 91% over the past year and has more than doubled over the past five years. </p><h2 class="wp-block-heading"><strong>Microsoft (MSFT)</strong></h2><div id="2151677" class="wp-caption alignright"><img src="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/plugins/lazy-load/images/1x1.trans.gif" data-lazy-src="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/01/msft-stock-microsoft-300x169.png" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="300" height="169" alt="The Microsoft logo outside a building representing MSFT stock." class="alignright wp-image-2151677" srcset="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/01/msft-stock-microsoft-300x169.png 300w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/01/msft-stock-microsoft-1024x576.png 1024w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/01/msft-stock-microsoft-768x432.png 768w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/01/msft-stock-microsoft-1536x864.png 1536w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/01/msft-stock-microsoft-200x113.png 200w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/01/msft-stock-microsoft-400x225.png 400w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/01/msft-stock-microsoft-116x65.png 116w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/01/msft-stock-microsoft-100x56.png 100w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/01/msft-stock-microsoft-89x50.png 89w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/01/msft-stock-microsoft-78x44.png 78w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/01/msft-stock-microsoft.png 1600w" sizes="(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px"><div class="ipm_image_source">Source: Asif Islam / Shutterstock.com</div></div><p><strong>Microsoft</strong> (NASDAQ:<span class="stock-ticker"><a href="https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/msft-stock-quote/"><strong><u>MSFT</u></strong></a></span>) is another leader in the cloud computing industry with a long history. The company unveiled Azure in 2010. Since then, it’s become one of the company’s most important sources of revenue and profits.</p><p>Azure is the foundation for the Microsoft Cloud category. The business segment generated $33.7 billion in <a href="https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/investor/earnings/fy-2024-q2/press-release-webcast" rel="nofollow">Q2 FY24</a> revenue, representing a 24% year-over-year increase. The corporation overall delivered 18% year-over-year revenue growth and 33% year-over-year net income growth. </p><p>Cloud computing isn’t the company’s only specialty. Recent investments in AI have panned out nicely and positioned Microsoft as a leader in the industry. The company also owns LinkedIn, Bing, Xbox and other entities. The company has exposure to many verticals and the financial might and leadership to tap into new opportunities. </p><p>Microsoft has been one of the most consistent <a class="auto-linked-term" href="https://investorplace.com/stock-types/growth-stocks/">growth stocks</a> in the market. Shares are up by 64% over the past year and 248% over the past five years. </p><h2 class="wp-block-heading"><strong>Alphabet (GOOG, GOOGL)</strong></h2><div id="2209537" class="wp-caption alignright"><img src="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/plugins/lazy-load/images/1x1.trans.gif" data-lazy-src="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/04/goog_googl_alphabet_1600-300x169.png" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="300" height="169" alt="Alphabet Inc. (GOOG, GOOGL) and Google logos seen displayed on smartphones. The Google stock split is happening today." class="alignright wp-image-2209537" srcset="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/04/goog_googl_alphabet_1600-300x169.png 300w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/04/goog_googl_alphabet_1600-1024x576.png 1024w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/04/goog_googl_alphabet_1600-768x432.png 768w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/04/goog_googl_alphabet_1600-1536x864.png 1536w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/04/goog_googl_alphabet_1600-200x113.png 200w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/04/goog_googl_alphabet_1600-400x225.png 400w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/04/goog_googl_alphabet_1600-116x65.png 116w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/04/goog_googl_alphabet_1600-100x56.png 100w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/04/goog_googl_alphabet_1600-89x50.png 89w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/04/goog_googl_alphabet_1600-78x44.png 78w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/04/goog_googl_alphabet_1600.png 1600w" sizes="(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px"><div class="ipm_image_source">Source: IgorGolovniov / Shutterstock.com</div></div><p>Some investors like to find smaller companies that offer more long-term upside. However, this list demonstrates that you can still get great returns from tech giants specializing in the cloud computing industry. </p><p><strong>Alphabet’s</strong> (NASDAQ:<span class="stock-ticker"><a href="https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/goog-stock-quote/"><strong><u>GOOG</u></strong></a></span>, NASDAQ:<span class="stock-ticker"><a href="https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/googl-stock-quote/"><strong><u>GOOGL</u></strong></a></span>) shares are up by more than 50% over the past year and have gained 135% over the past five years. Google Cloud has been a focal point of revenue acceleration and has been around since 2008.</p><p>The company’s <a href="https://abc.xyz/assets/95/eb/9cef90184e09bac553796896c633/2023q4-alphabet-earnings-release.pdf" rel="nofollow">fourth-quarter earnings report</a> highlighted a broad recovery in the advertising market. Alphabet’s revenue increased by 13% year-over-year, while net income jumped by more than 50% year-over-year. </p><p>Google Cloud was a big reason for the company’s financial success. Its revenue jumped from $7.3 billion in Q4 2022 to $9.2 billion in Q4 2023. That’s a 26% year-over-year increase. Google Cloud also flipped a net loss into a net profit, resulting in higher net profit margins moving forward.</p><p><em>On this date of publication, Marc Guberti held long positions in MSFT and GOOG. The opinions expressed in this article are those of the writer, subject to the InvestorPlace.com </em><a href="https://investorplace.com/corporate/investorplace-publishing-guidelines/"><em>Publishing Guidelines.</em></a></p><div class="ipm-author-short-bio"><p>Marc Guberti is a finance freelance writer at InvestorPlace.com who hosts the Breakthrough Success Podcast. articles.title: 3 Stocks to Buy for Strong Cash-Generating Abilities
summarizedBulletPoints: - Strong cash flows indicate financial stability for companies, allowing them to pay down debt, pursue growth initiatives, and distribute dividends, thereby preparing them to endure economic downturns more effectively.
- Verizon Communications (VZ), Microsoft (MSFT), and Visa (V) are highlighted as companies with robust cash-generating capabilities.
- **Microsoft (MSFT)**:
- Recognized as part of the 'Magnificent 7', Microsoft has seen its shares surge by 60% over the past year, significantly outperforming the market.
- Analysts hold a positive outlook on Microsoft, assigning it a Zacks Rank #2 (Buy).
- Microsoft has generated approximately $67.5 billion in free cash flow over its latest twelve-month period, showcasing operational efficiency.
- MSFT shares offer a passive income stream, with a current annual yield of 0.7%.
- Expectations for Microsoft's current year include 19% earnings growth on 15% higher sales, with projections for FY25 suggesting 13% earnings growth and 14% revenue growth.
- **Verizon Communications (VZ)**:
- Verizon shares have slightly outperformed the general market year-to-date, with an approximately 8% increase in value.
- The company has generated $18.7 billion in free cash flow over its latest twelve-month period.
- VZ shares offer a considerable passive income opportunity with an annual yield of 6.7% and have shown a modest 2% five-year annualized dividend growth rate.
- Visa is recognized for its significant cash generation, with $19.1 billion in free cash flow over the latest trailing twelve-month period.
- Analysts are optimistic about Visa's current year outlook, predicting a 3.4% increase in the Zacks Consensus EPS estimate from the previous year, signifying a 13% year-over-year growth.
- Visa shares have also modestly outperformed the S&P 500 year-to-date, with an 8% gain.

- Investing in companies with strong cash-generating abilities is beneficial as they are well-equipped to fund growth, provide dividends, and reduce debt, especially appealing during economic downturns.
articles.desc:
Strong cash flows reflect financial stability, allowing companies to pay down debt, pursue growth opportunities, and shell out dividend payments. These companies are also better equipped to weather an economic downturn, providing another beneficial advantage for investors from a long-term standpoint.

And for those interested in investing in strong cash flows, three companies – Verizon Communications VZ, Microsoft MSFT, and Visa V – are all cash-generating machines. Let’s take a closer look at each.

Microsoft

A member of the ‘Magnificent 7’, Microsoft shares have helped lead the market over the past year, up 60% and outperforming in a big way. Analysts have taken a bullish stance on the company’s outlook, landing it into a favorable Zacks Rank #2 (Buy). Zacks Investment Research

Image Source: Zacks Investment Research

The company generated nearly $67.5 billion in free cash flow over its latest trailing twelve-month period, owing to its operational efficiency. Investors also stand to enjoy a passive income stream from MSFT shares, currently yielding 0.7% annually. Zacks Investment Research

Image Source: Zacks Investment Research

The company’s growth profile remains constructive, with consensus expectations for its current year suggesting 19% earnings growth on 15% higher sales. Peeking ahead to FY25, earnings and revenue are currently forecasted to climb 13% and 14%, respectively.

Verizon Communications

Verizon shares have modestly outperformed relative to the general market year-to-date, adding roughly 8% in value vs. the S&P 500’s 7% gain. The communications giant has generated $18.7 billion in free cash flow over its latest trailing twelve-month period. Zacks Investment Research

Image Source: Zacks Investment Research

Similar to MSFT, investors stand to reap a passive income from VZ shares, currently yielding a sizable 6.7% annually. Dividend growth is also apparent, with the company carrying a modest 2% five-year annualized dividend growth rate. Zacks Investment Research

Image Source: Zacks Investment Research

Visa

Like the companies above, financial services heavyweight Visa is a serious cash generator, posting $19.1 billion in free cash flow over its latest trailing twelve-month period.

Story continues Zacks Investment Research

Image Source: Zacks Investment Research

Analysts have taken a positive stance on its current year outlook, with the $9.90 Zacks Consensus EPS estimate up 3.4% over the last year and suggesting year-over-year growth of 13%. Shares have modestly outperformed relative to the S&P 500 year-to-date, gaining 8%. Zacks Investment Research

Image Source: Zacks Investment Research

Shares trade at an elevated multiple but are somewhat cheap on a historical basis, with the current 26.9X forward 12-month earnings multiple beneath the 28.2X five-year median and highs of 40.6X over the same time period.

Bottom Line

Companies boasting strong cash-generating abilities can be great investments, as they have plenty of cash to fuel growth, pay out dividends, and easily wipe out debt. And as mentioned above, these companies are better equipped to handle an economic downturn, undeniably a positive.

For those seeking cash-generators, all three above – Verizon Communications VZ, Microsoft MSFT, and Visa V – fit the criteria nicely.

Zacks

3 Stocks to Buy for Strong Cash-Generating Abilities

Derek Lewis
March 11, 2024 at 3:54 PM·3 min read

Strong cash flows reflect financial stability, allowing companies to pay down debt, pursue growth opportunities, and shell out dividend payments. These companies are also better equipped to weather an economic downturn, providing another beneficial advantage for investors from a long-term standpoint.

And for those interested in investing in strong cash flows, three companies – Verizon Communications VZ, Microsoft MSFT, and Visa V – are all cash-generating machines. Let’s take a closer look at each.

Microsoft

A member of the ‘Magnificent 7’, Microsoft shares have helped lead the market over the past year, up 60% and outperforming in a big way. Analysts have taken a bullish stance on the company’s outlook, landing it into a favorable Zacks Rank #2 (Buy).


Image Source: Zacks Investment Research

The company generated nearly $67.5 billion in free cash flow over its latest trailing twelve-month period, owing to its operational efficiency. Investors also stand to enjoy a passive income stream from MSFT shares, currently yielding 0.7% annually.


Image Source: Zacks Investment Research

The company’s growth profile remains constructive, with consensus expectations for its current year suggesting 19% earnings growth on 15% higher sales. Peeking ahead to FY25, earnings and revenue are currently forecasted to climb 13% and 14%, respectively.

Verizon Communications

Verizon shares have modestly outperformed relative to the general market year-to-date, adding roughly 8% in value vs. the S&P 500’s 7% gain. The communications giant has generated $18.7 billion in free cash flow over its latest trailing twelve-month period.


Image Source: Zacks Investment Research

Similar to MSFT, investors stand to reap a passive income from VZ shares, currently yielding a sizable 6.7% annually. Dividend growth is also apparent, with the company carrying a modest 2% five-year annualized dividend growth rate.


Image Source: Zacks Investment Research

Visa

Like the companies above, financial services heavyweight Visa is a serious cash generator, posting $19.1 billion in free cash flow over its latest trailing twelve-month period.

Image Source: Zacks Investment Research

Analysts have taken a positive stance on its current year outlook, with the $9.90 Zacks Consensus EPS estimate up 3.4% over the last year and suggesting year-over-year growth of 13%. Shares have modestly outperformed relative to the S&P 500 year-to-date, gaining 8%.

Image Source: Zacks Investment Research

Shares trade at an elevated multiple but are somewhat cheap on a historical basis, with the current 26.9X forward 12-month earnings multiple beneath the 28.2X five-year median and highs of 40.6X over the same time period.

Bottom Line

Companies boasting strong cash-generating abilities can be great investments, as they have plenty of cash to fuel growth, pay out dividends, and easily wipe out debt. And as mentioned above, these companies are better equipped to handle an economic downturn, undeniably a positive.

For those seeking cash-generators, all three above – Verizon Communications VZ, Microsoft MSFT, and Visa V – fit the criteria nicely.
